com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.graph

Class Hallway

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projecttango.unibw.graphmapper.graph.Hallway

  • public class Hallway
extends java.lang.Object

    A hallway is a closed area in a building. It can have connections to other hallway with entrypoints. It can also have markers and rooms and cutted obstacles within it. A hallway can be seen as a node of the navigation graph / network.

    This class is based on the class "Floorplan" of the Jave floorplan example found on https://github.com/googlesamples/tango-examples-java. Added changes of Google's Okul update from June 9th (13.06.2016). This class was created by Konstantin Klinger on 25.04.16.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Konstantin Klinger

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Entrypoint> mConnections
      List of entrypoints at this hallway
      private java.util.List<java.util.List<float[]>> mCuttedObstacleList
      List of obstacles that muste be cutted out of this hallway
      private java.util.List<float[]> mHallwayPoints
      List of Points (usually corners) of the hallway.
      private int mID
      Unique ID of this hallway to avoid recursive connections between hallways.
      private int mLevel
      Level where the hallway is located
      private java.util.List<Marker> mMarkers
      List of markers (points of interest, e.g. position of bluetooth beacons)
      private java.lang.String mName
      Name of the hallway
      private java.util.List<Room> mRooms
      List of rooms at this hallway

    • Field Detail

      • mHallwayPoints

        private java.util.List<float[]> mHallwayPoints
        List of Points (usually corners) of the hallway. Each point is a float[3] with x, z and y coordinates.

      • mName

        private java.lang.String mName
        Name of the hallway

      • mLevel

        private int mLevel
        Level where the hallway is located

      • mRooms

        private java.util.List<Room> mRooms
        List of rooms at this hallway

      • mConnections

        private java.util.List<Entrypoint> mConnections
        List of entrypoints at this hallway

      • mCuttedObstacleList

        private java.util.List<java.util.List<float[]>> mCuttedObstacleList
        List of obstacles that muste be cutted out of this hallway

      • mMarkers

        private java.util.List<Marker> mMarkers
        List of markers (points of interest, e.g. position of bluetooth beacons)

      • mID

        private int mID
        Unique ID of this hallway to avoid recursive connections between hallways. So the graph could be saved with GSON

      • drawOnCanvas

        public void drawOnCanvas(Canvas canvas,
                Paint paint,
                float[] planCenter,
                float scale,
                boolean showText,
                boolean showName,
                boolean showObstacles)
        This is the public plan drawing functions. It draws the plan with the user's wished options.
        Parameters:
        canvas - (canvas where the plan is drawn)
        paint - (color and size settings)
        planCenter - (precalulated center of the plan)
        scale - (precalculated scale of the plan)
        showText - (if true the lenght of the lines are shown)
        showName - (if true the name of the hallway will also be drawn)
        showObstacles - (if true the obstacles of the hallway will also be drawn)

      • drawName

        private void drawName(Canvas canvas,
            Paint paint,
            float[] pos)
        This function draws the name of the hallway in the middle of it.
        Parameters:
        canvas - (Canvas where the name will be drawn.)
        paint - (Color settings and size of the point)
        pos - (position of the text)

      • draw2dlines

        private float[] draw2dlines(Canvas canvas,
                  Paint paint,
                  float[] planCenter,
                  float scale)
        This function draws a line between each corner of the hallway.
        Parameters:
        canvas - (canvas where the plan is drawn)
        paint - (color and size settings)
        planCenter - (precalulated center of the plan)
        scale - (precalculated scale of the plan)
        Returns:
        x and y position of the last point to draw the name of the hallway above it

      • draw2dlinesObstacles

        private void draw2dlinesObstacles(Canvas canvas,
                        Paint paint,
                        float[] planCenter,
                        float scale)
        This function draws every obstacle on the canvas. It draws a line between each corner of every obstacle.
        Parameters:
        canvas - (canvas where the plan is drawn)
        paint - (color and size settings)
        planCenter - (precalulated center of the plan)
        scale - (precalculated scale of the plan)

      • drawTexts

        private void drawTexts(Canvas canvas,
             Paint paint,
             float[] planCenter,
             float scale)
        This function calculates the length of the lines (from corner to corner) of the hallway and draws it in the middle of each line on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        canvas - (canvas where the text is drawn)
        paint - (color and size settings)
        planCenter - (precalculated center of the plan)
        scale - (precalculated scale of the plan)

      • drawTextsObstacles

        private void drawTextsObstacles(Canvas canvas,
                      Paint paint,
                      float[] planCenter,
                      float scale)
        This function calculates the length of the lines (from corner to corner) of the hallway's obstacles and draws it in the middle of each line on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        canvas - (canvas where the text is drawn)
        paint - (color and size settings)
        planCenter - (precalculated center of the plan)
        scale - (precalculated scale of the plan)

      • translateAndScaleHallway

        private Hallway translateAndScaleHallway(float[] planCenter,
                               float scale,
                               java.util.List<float[]> unscaledPoints)
        This function calculates a new hallway for a list of unscaled hallway points with a predefined / precalculated planCenter and scale.
        Parameters:
        planCenter - (precalculated center of the plan / canvas)
        scale - (precalculated scale of the plan / canvas)
        unscaledPoints - (list of unscaled points)
        Returns:
        new hallway with all points in the precalculated scale

      • getHallwayPoints

        public java.util.List<float[]> getHallwayPoints()
        Getter function for the hallway points of this hallway (mHallwayPoints).
        Returns:
        new List of the hallway points from this Hallway.
